Agreement Signed between DPRK and Chinese Journalists Organizations 
    Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- An agreement on friendship and cooperation was signed between the Korean Journalists Union and the All-China Journalists Association on Aug. 10.
 Present at the signing ceremony on the DPRK side were Vice-Chairman Kim Sang Ho of the C.C., the Korean Journalists Union and officials concerned and, on the Chinese side, the members of the delegation of the All-China Journalists Association headed by Wei Mingxiang, member of the Secretariat of the association.

articles.content:
Surprise Demonstrations in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Students affiliated with the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) on Aug. 8 staged a surprise demonstration against the building of Wonju district, Kangwon Province of south Korea, of the Grand National Party, according to south Korean MBC.
 The students broke into the party building by surprise and destroyed the door in angry protest.    
 Earlier, other students of Hanchongryon made surprise attacks on the Mokpho, Taegu, Pusan and South Jolla Provincial buildings of the GNP in turn from Aug. 2 to 6 and destroyed the signboards.

articles.title: International Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition to Be Held
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Chad 
    Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Aug. 6 sent a message of greetings to Idris Deby, president of Chad, on the occasion of the 43rd anniversary of its independence.
 The message wished the president and the people of Chad greater achievements in their work for peace and prosperity of the country and expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms.

International Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition to Be Held 
    Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The 3rd Pyongyang International Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition will be held from Aug. 18 to 21 amid the interest and expectation of scientists and technicians of the DPRK and other countries.
 It will draw more than 20 organizations of over 10 countries and international organizations. It will mark an important occasion in further strengthening the scientific and technological exchange and cooperation among countries.

Delegation of DPRK Foreign Ministry Leaves for Russia
    Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Foreign Ministry led by its Vice-Minister Kung Sok Ung left here today to visit Russia, according to the program for exchange between the foreign ministries of the two countries.

articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Indonesian President
    Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- President Kim Yong Nam of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on August 9 sent a message  to President Megawati Soekarnoputri of Indonesia expressing sympathy with the fact that a bomb blasted at a hotel in Jakarta, causing many  casualties .
 The message reiterated the principled stand of the DPRK against all forms of terrorism and bitterly denounced the recent terrorism.    
 It expressed the conviction that the president and government of Indonesia would do away with the consequences of the incident and bring the life of the residents in the afflicted area to normal as soon as possible.
